message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "To analyze the impact of economic sanctions on poverty, we utilize panel data from the World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) and the United Nations Development Programme's Human Development Index (HDI).", "dataset": ["World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI)", "United Nations Development Programme's Human Development Index (HDI)"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research examines the gender differences in human capital accumulation in India using a dataset from the National Sample Survey Organisation (NSSO) and the Annual Status of Education Report (ASER) published by Pratham.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey Organisation (NSSO)", "Annual Status of Education Report (ASER) published by Pratham"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we investigate the causal relationship between education and health outcomes in Malawi using data from the Malawi Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and the Integrated Household Panel Survey (IHPS).", "dataset": ["Malawi Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Integrated Household Panel Survey (IHPS)"], "topic": ["Education", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using firm-level datasets from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Global Financial Inclusion (Global Findex) database provided by the World Bank Group, we examine the determinants and effects of access to finance on firm-level foreign investment decisions in emerging markets.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Global Financial Inclusion (Global Findex) database provided by the World Bank Group"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We assess the impact of urbanization on nutritional status of children in sub-Saharan Africa using household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys Program (DHS) and Global Urban Growth Indicators (GUGI) collected by the World Bank.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys Program (DHS)", "Global Urban Growth Indicators (GUGI) collected by the World Bank"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "The study considers the impact of government spending on income disparity in Brazil making use of data from the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE) and the World Income Database.", "dataset": ["Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE)", "World Income Database"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the impact of climate change on crop yields, we employ district level panel data spanning more than 30 years from the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) of the United Nations and World Bank's Agro-Climate Toolkits (ACTs).", "dataset": ["India Meteorological Department (IMD)", "Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) of the United Nations", "World Bank's Agro-Climate Toolkits (ACTs)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using high-frequency mobile phone data provided by call detail records made available through a partnership between Facebook and Vodafone in six African countries, we examine the relationship between drought and internal migration patterns in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["call detail records made available through a partnership between Facebook and Vodafone"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize datasets obtained from the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS) for different years of American Community Surveys (ACS) and from Decennial Census to analyze the impact of residential segregation on intergenerational mobility in the United States.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS)", "American Community Surveys (ACS)", "Decennial Census"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study explores the relationship between natural disasters and tourism in large cities around the world, drawing on several datasets including DisasterData.org, OpenStreetMap, CityGML, as well as geotagged social media data from Twitter and Instagram.", "dataset": ["DisasterData.org", "OpenStreetMap", "CityGML", "geotagged social media data from Twitter and Instagram"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}]
